decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

The proposed development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the materials detailed under Section 5 of the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the appearance of the proposed development will harmonise with the character of the surrounding area and comply with Policy DC61 of the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, no window or other opening (other than those shown on the submitted and approved plan,) shall be formed in the flank wall(s) of the building(s) hereby permitted, unless specific permission under the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 has first been sought and obtained in writing from the Local Planning Authority.

In order to ensure a satisfactory development that will not result in any loss of privacy or damage to the environment of neighbouring properties which exist or may be proposed in the future, and in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

The proposed first floor windows on the eastern and western flank elevations shall be permanently glazed with obscure glass not less than level 4 on the standard scale of obscurity and shall thereafter be maintained and
permanently fixed shut and thereafter maintained, with the exception of any top hung fanlight(s).
In the interests of privacy, and in order that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

Prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted, a privacy screen shall be erected along the first floor rear balcony.  The screen shall extend along the full length of the outer edges of the balcony and shall be of solid opaque design, measuring a minimum of 1.7m in height above the finished floor level of the balcony.  The screen shall then remain in place and no alterations shall take place to it thereafter.

To protect the privacy of adjoining properties and to prevent undue overlooking of adjoining properties and to ensure that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.
description: Roof enlargement and loft extension to include dormer windows. Single/two storey front extension and a single storey side extension. Single/ two storey rear extension to include new swimming pool enclosure.
